column4: I updated from 12.04 to 12.10 today and now have no dash, and no bar across the top of my desktop. only the desktop icons I had before
anyone have an idea how to get my dash back?
Blackphyr> I did before. but I'm not sure how I can re-install it since I can't get to the settings / drivers
before I was able to install my graphics driver by going to 'additional drivers' in settings
now that feature is in the Software Sources application, in a tab
but we need to know your card. On a terminal write 'lspci |grep AMD' the paste the output here
you don't, do as i said :)
i can't remember what your issue was?
I have no dash. nothing but desktop icons
AMD dropped driver support for your card
you could try amd legacy, but i don't know if it works, can't guarantee that :S
i don't know if you should... do you know how to revert to default in case you have any problem?
lets try the ubuntu fglrx driver first, the one that is on the repositories
